lines.text: Y'know, I have the strangest feeling that this is the beginning of a beautiful hatred.
...and Geoffrey, this is 'Penny'.
You I've got news, I don't think i'm going to like you.
Pity, I was just about to kiss you.
Ah Christine! Been cleaning the silver, have you?
That's right doctor, you've got a great sense of perception. How's Mrs. Carroll this morning?
Improved I'm glad to say. Much improved! Oh by the way Christine, have you heard the latest about the burglar? Last night he...

[cuts him off]
I know doctor. Heard all about it.
Oh, uh, where's you master?
Up in Heaven.
I beg your pardon?
If you're talking about my 'Master', he's up in Heaven. But if you're talking about my employer Mr. Carroll, he's out in the garden.
The garden? What's he doing out there on a day like this?
Minding his own business, i should think.

[Dr. Tuttle walks away]
... 'minding his own business'... humph!

[says under her breath]
Nosy old fossil.
Ah Christine, this miserable weather and all... did, did you put the whiskey out?
I knew you were coming, didn't I?
Oh, good, good!
[he walks to the bar]
Christine, I must compliment you.
Me?
Yes. I feel if you were polished, thoroughly polished mind you, you'd be a rough diamond.
[he then turns and follows the doctor to the bar]
[Christine at first has a happy expression on her face, then the expression slowly turns into a scowl]
